title: Weekly Roundup: Thursday, April 7
description: A look at the race and a new level of testiness, especially among Democrats, as the primary season moves from Wisconsin to New York, plus the latest on a string of religious freedom laws in states like Mississippi and North Carolina making national news. This episode, host/White House correspondent Tamara Keith, campaign reporter Sam Sanders, digital political reporter Danielle Kurtzleben, and editor/correspondent Ron Elving. Find the team on Twitter @tamarakeithNPR, @samsanders, @titonka, and @NPRrelving, or email the show at nprpolitics@npr.org. More coverage at nprpolitics.org.
